revised_title: Flexural Waves and Fracture Dynamics in Glass Fibers
tldr: The authors studied the dynamic response of glass fibers during tensile fracture and observed the propagation of flexural waves. These waves cause secondary 'explosive' failures in the fibers, resulting in a cloud of particulate matter. The research provides insights into the fragmentation process of high-strength glass fibers and the role of flexural waves in their failure.
